constellations_other.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

constellations_other.name: Warwick Thornton
constellations_other.description: Brimming with Shakespearean undertones and pathos, Kaytetye filmmaker Warwick Thornton's debut feature Samson and Delilah is both a universal tale and one intrinsically tied to the experience of First Peoples in Central Australia.

results.title: Little J & Big Cuz
results.brief_description: Little J, he’s five and Big Cuz, she’s nine. They’re a couple of Indigenous Australian kids living with their Nanna and Old Dog.

constellations_primary.name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
constellations_primary.description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

constellations_other.name: Learning through play
constellations_other.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

results.description: Little J, he’s five and Big Cuz, she’s nine. They’re a couple of Indigenous Australian kids living with their Nanna and Old Dog.

results.title: Little houses for little people
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Ronald A Weinberg, Micheline Charest, BRB International, Miramax Films and Cinar Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of David the Gnome”.
David tells us more about the magical world of the gnomes. In “Little houses for little people” he explains the gnomes’ secret and special underground houses. “The wedding that almost wasn’t” - All the Gnomes gather to celebrate a wedding - but the trolls are unwelcome guests! Based on “The gnomes” by Rien Poortvliet and Wil Huygen. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ernest Reid, Ronald A Weinberg, Micheline Charest, BRB International, Miramax Films and Cinar Films

results.title: Little golden memories
results.creator_credit: Jim Bousman and Western Publishing Company
results.brief_description: Stories from twelve of the best loved Little Golden Books. - Poky little puppy and the patchwork blanket. - Theodore Mouse goes to sea. - Tawny scrawny lion. - Sailor dog. - Rupert the rhinoceros. - Jack and the beanstalk. - Saggy baggy elephant. - Little toad to the rescue. - Scruffy the tugboat. - Three Billy Goats Gruff. - Little Red Riding Hood. - What was that?

results.title: Little girl Jaed
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This drama recounts a girl’s tragic journey of drug addiction. Feelings of isolation and loneliness mount as a girl struggles with everyday life - at school and at home. Her friends begin to reject her, as her family does when they can no longer cope with her behaviour. As she tries to come to grips with her dependency, her family bond comes to breaking point and she is eventually thrown out of the family home. A bleak story of how drug addiction can ruin a person’s life.

results.title: Little Flower = Xiao Hua [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Zhang Zheng and Beijing Film Studio
results.brief_description: Set in 1930, this melodrama focuses on the fate of two sisters who are separated as babies and grow up in different families unaware of each other’s existence. They are reunited by chance as young adults after they join the People’s Liberation Army where they also discover their long lost brother. Cast includes Joan Chen, Liu Xiaoquing, Cheng Chong and Guoqiang Tang. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Little echo lost
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Jane Keneally and Armagan Ballantyne
results.brief_description: The EchoMan has never questioned his existence till now. One day he witnesses an event that brings into question everything he stands for and believes in. Stars Hugo Weaving as the EchoMan and Alana de Roma as the young girl. Original format 35mm.
